item.title: Feynman's words
item.description:
These words come from Feynman’s twitter.

  • It doesn’t matter how beautiful your theory is. If it disagrees with experiment, it’s wrong. In that simple statement is the key to science.
  • We must be careful not to believe things simply because we want them to be true. No one can fool you as easily as you can fool yourself!
  • I was an ordinary person who studied hard. There’s no miracle people!
  • hours ago Teach principles not formulas.
  • There is no “authority” who decides what is a good idea.
  • Religion is a culture of faith; science is a culture of doubt.
  • Students should be made to think like scientists, be open-minded, curious, and especially, to doubt.
  • Teach principles not formulas.
  • There is no “authority” who decides what is a good idea.
  • I’m smart enough to know that I’m dumb.
  • We never are definitely right, we can only be sure we are wrong.
  • Physics isn’t the most important thing. Love is.
  • When we know that we actually live in uncertainty, then we ought to admit it; it is of great value to realize that we do not know answers!
  • You’re unlikely to discover something new without a lot of practice on old stuff.
  • The statements of science are not of what is true and what is not true, but statements of what is known with different degrees of certainty.
  • It is imperative in science to doubt; it is absolutely necessary, for progress in science, to have uncertainty as a fundamental part of your inner nature. To make progress in understanding, we must remain modest and allow that we do not know.
  • The only way to deep happiness is to do something you love to the best of your ability.
  • If you cannot explain something in simple terms, you don’t understand it.
  • Teach principles not formulas.
  • Religion is a culture of faith; science is a culture of doubt.
  • It is imperative in science to doubt; it is absolutely necessary, for progress in science, to have uncertainty as a fundamental part of your inner nature.
  • We must be careful not to believe things simply because we want them to be true. No one can fool you as easily as you can fool yourself!
  • Scientists are explorers. Philosophers are tourists.
  • If you have any talent, any occupation that delights you, do it, and do it to the hilt. Don’t ask why or what difficulties you may get into.
